lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities
pinyin: chai2 mi3 you2 yan2 jiang4 cu4 cha2

sentences.english: Maybe we could have done better, in areas of worldly things;
sentences.chinese: 也許，我們能在柴米油鹽的世界裏做得更好些。

sentences.english: But the reality is daily necessities, is basin of boiler bowl gourd ladle.
sentences.chinese: 然而現實是柴米油鹽，是鍋碗瓢盆。

definition: lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities

definition: to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
trifling/trivial/tedious/inconsequential
many/diverse
to find amusement in one's own way/to enjoy oneself quietly
to live like a prince (idiom)
wind, flower, snow and moon, trite poetry subject (idiom); effete language without substance/love affair/romance is in the air/dissipated life
dull/insipid
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
day after day
to accumulate over a long period of time
to bear and raise children
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
trifle
